participant_1.background:
I fear that I will lose my pets, because they are the only ones who truly understand me.
that way , after graduating , i can teach english there for a year or two.
I get along with my family well.
i still have a thick accent so words like hippopotamus are difficult.
My spouse is a doctor who works long hours, but they always make time for me and our dog.

participant_2.background:
My first cup of coffee in the morning inspires me to write and create content for my blog.
Leaving my father behind when I immigrated to the United States.
I enjoy creating beautiful wedding cakes for people to enjoy on their special day.
i love wearing flip flops.
I travel to the mountains and enjoy my free time.

content.text: Hi there, I'm currently in school to be an English teacher. How about you?
Nice! I'm a baker. I love creating beautiful wedding cakes for people to enjoy on their special day. What are you most excited about with teaching English?

I love learning about different cultures and languages, so I'm excited to get to know my students and learn about their own cultures. I'm also excited to be able to help them learn English and improve their communication skills.
That's awesome! I'm sure you'll be a great teacher. I love learning about new cultures too, but I'm not sure if I'd be good at teaching English. I think I'd be better at teaching baking!
I'm sure you would be great at teaching baking too! And you could always combine the two and teach English to your students while you're baking with them.
That's a great idea! I could have them help me make the cakes and then we could practice their English while we're working.
That would be so much fun! I'm sure your students would love it.
Thanks! I think they would too.
I live in the mountains of Colorado. It's beautiful here, but it can get pretty cold in the winter.
That sounds amazing! I've always wanted to live in the mountains.
It's definitely a great place to live. There's so much to do outside, and the views are incredible.
Sounds like I need to visit Colorado sometime!
